latihan.arahan: Join the sentences using (so that, because, since).

soalan.teks: He studied hard. He wanted to pass the exam. (so that)
soalan.jawapan: He studied hard so that he could pass the exam.

soalan.teks: She was late. She missed the bus. (because)
soalan.jawapan: She was late because she missed the bus.

soalan.teks: It is raining. We should stay inside. (since)
soalan.jawapan: Since it is raining, we should stay inside.

soalan.teks: I wore a coat. I didn't want to feel cold. (so that)
soalan.jawapan: I wore a coat so that I wouldn't feel cold.

soalan.teks: He failed. He didn't study. (because)
soalan.jawapan: He failed because he didn't study.

soalan.teks: You are here. Let's start the meeting. (since)
soalan.jawapan: Since you are here, let's start the meeting.

soalan.teks: Speak louder. Everyone can hear you. (so that)
soalan.jawapan: Speak louder so that everyone can hear you.

soalan.teks: I am hungry. I haven't eaten anything. (because)
soalan.jawapan: I am hungry because I haven't eaten anything.

soalan.teks: It's a holiday. The shops are closed. (since)
soalan.jawapan: Since it's a holiday, the shops are closed.

soalan.teks: Save money. You can buy a bicycle. (so that)
soalan.jawapan: Save money so that you can buy a bicycle.
